definition: to tease
to clutch/to grab/to capture
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: However, the fate of teaser , your stock has fallen to 7 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 然而命運捉弄人，你的股票跌到7元了。

sentences.english: Life often makes fun of those who haven't been around.
sentences.chinese: 生活常常捉弄涉世不深的人。

sentences.english: A mean boy teases the dog.
sentences.chinese: 一個淘氣的男孩在捉弄着狗。

sentences.english: The best way to deal with a tease is to ignore him.
sentences.chinese: 對付愛捉弄人的人的最佳方法就是不搭理他。

sentences.english: Every April Fool 's Day, Xiaoqiang would think of ways to trick others.
sentences.chinese: 小強每年愚人節都想着法子捉弄別人。

sentences.english: Google has a tradition of perpetrating April Fools' Day hoaxes.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌有個在愚人節捉弄人的傳統。

sentences.english: Ken got angry with Sue when he found out that he had been fooled by her.
sentences.chinese: 肯很生蘇的氣當他發現自己被她捉弄了。

sentences.english: Fate of the teaser, but please do not this to me.
sentences.chinese: 命運捉弄人，不過，請你不要這樣對我。

sentences.english: I tricked my brother yesterday by putting some cold water in his shoes!
sentences.chinese: 我昨天捉弄了我的哥哥一頓，把涼水放進了他的鞋裏。

sentences.english: The little horror never stops playing tricks on his parents.
sentences.chinese: 那個小淘氣鬼不停地捉弄他的父母。

sentences.english: The naughty boys played jokes on John and hid his clothes while he was swimming.
sentences.chinese: 頑皮的男孩捉弄約翰，他們在他泅水時將衣服藏起來。

sentences.english: Don't talk about people behind their backs.
They played a joke on him by letting down the tyres of his bike.
sentences.chinese: 他們捉弄他，把他的自行車的輪胎放了氣。

sentences.english: She sometimes behaves weirdly and often makes fun of Kanata.
sentences.chinese: 有時會作出一些不可思議的舉動，經常捉弄彼方。

sentences.english: God is like the sub-tease people.
But fate intervenes when the house of Kotoko's family is destroyed by a meteor.
sentences.chinese: 但命運捉弄，琴子的家被一顆流星夷爲平地。

to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
